page.title: 01Appleby - A General Guide
page.content: The area around Appleby is mainly farmland.The land is undulating,dotted with trees and houses.The river Eden runs through the area.Most of the buildings are made out of the local red/orange sandstone.Appleby has some very old buildings.The castle dates back to the eleventh century.St. Lawrences Church is almost as old and contains the tomb of Lady Anne Clifford. Early closing day is Thursday and market day Saturday .We dont have any big supermarkets.Mainly family businesses serve the needs of Appleby,the surrounding villages and tourists.Appleby is a very attractive place.You can come by train on the Settle to Carlise line,by car on the A66 or by bus.There is a tourist information office in the twelfth century Moot Hall. James Belford
